inclusion.criterion: spinal cord injury and/or chronic, irreversible neuropathic bladder dysfunction from other progressive neurological syndromes including Stroke, multiple sclerosis and Parkinsonism.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Candidates must have a minimum duration of injury and bladder dysfunction of 2 years
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: utilize an indwelling Foley catheter, an indwelling suprapubic catheter, diapers or external (condom) catheter drainage or intermittent self-catheterization but finds the current alternative to be socially unsatisfactory.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: recognize the investigational nature of the 'tissue bonding cystostomy' device and must be willing to return for periodic follow-up
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: be willing and capable of signing the Informed Consent Document (ICD)
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: have a reversible spinal cord injury or a reversible neurological illness
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: have been injured less than two years
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has severe 2cm bulbar urethral stricture and requires surgical intervention. He is currently managed with a foley catheter, which leaks around the catheter.
